steps: Rinse the rice and soak for 30 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a large pot and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, cumin, and biryani masala, and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chicken, tomatoes, yogurt, turmeric, and salt. Cook until chicken is done.
In a separate pot, boil 3 cups of water, then add the soaked rice and cook until 70% done.
Layer the partially cooked rice over the chicken mixture, add chopped coriander and mint, and cover the pot tightly.
Cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until rice is fully cooked.
Serve hot with raita or salad.
In a large bowl, combine minced beef, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, pepper, salt, and parsley.
Mix well and shape into small patties or skewers.
Heat olive oil in a grill pan over medium heat.
Grill the kebabs for 5-6 minutes on each side until cooked through.
Serve hot with naan, salad, or rice.
In a food processor, blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, baking powder, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Shape the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a frying pan and fry falafel until golden and crispy.
Warm the tortillas and spread a thin layer of tahini sauce.
Place falafel on the tortilla and top with lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers.
Roll up the wrap and serve immediately.
Rinse the rice and soak for 20 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a large pot and sauté onions until soft.
Add garlic, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Add lamb cubes and cook until browned.
Add grated carrot and cook for 2 more minutes.
Add the drained rice and stir to coat.
Pour in chicken broth, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the rice is fully cooked.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.
In a bowl, marinate the chicken with shawarma spice mix, yogurt, and olive oil for 30 minutes.
Cook the marinated chicken in a pan until fully cooked and browned.
Warm pita breads and spread garlic sauce or tahini.
Place cooked chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers inside the pita.
Roll up the pita and serve warm.
In a bowl, marinate the beef strips with soy sauce and oyster sauce for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a wok and sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add beef strips and stir-fry until browned.
Add sliced bell pepper and onion, and stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes.
Serve hot with cooked rice.
In a large bowl, mix tandoori masala, yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.
Add the chicken drumsticks to the mixture and marinate for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place marinated chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 35 minutes, turning halfway.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Transfer the hummus to a serving bowl, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with paprika.
Serve with pita bread or vegetable sticks.

ingredients: 500g halal boneless chicken, cut into cubes

steps: In a bowl, mix tikka masala, yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.
Add chicken cubes to the mixture and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers.
Grill the chicken skewers for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until fully cooked.
Serve with naan or rice and a side of yogurt dip.
In a food processor, blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt until smooth.
Shape the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the falafel until golden brown on all sides.
Serve with pita bread, salad, and tahini sauce.
In a bowl, mix ground beef, onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, coriander, and salt.
Shape the mixture into small kofta balls or onto skewers.
Grill the koftas on medium heat for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve hot with rice, salad, or flatbread.
In a pot, sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add cumin, turmeric, tomato paste, and stir for a minute.
Add lentils, chickpeas, and water to cover. Bring to a boil and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add vermicelli noodles and cook for another 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro.
In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Add the chicken cubes and marinate for 1 hour.
Thread the chicken onto skewers and grill for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve with naan or rice and a side of chutney.
Cook the basmati rice until half done, then set aside.
In a pot, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add cumin, garam masala, and lamb cubes, and cook until lamb is browned.
Add yogurt and simmer the lamb until tender, about 30 minutes.
Layer the lamb with the half-cooked rice, cover, and steam for 15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.
In a pan, melt butter and sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add tomato sauce, garam masala, and salt. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the chicken cubes and cook for 15-20 minutes until chicken is fully cooked.
Stir in cream and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.
In a pan, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until soft.
Add curry powder, turmeric, and tomatoes, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the fish fillets and cook for 10-15 minutes until fully cooked.
If desired, stir in coconut milk and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice.
Marinate the beef slices in shawarma seasoning, yogurt, garlic, and olive oil for 1 hour.
Heat a pan and cook the beef until fully cooked and browned, about 20-25 minutes.
Warm the pita bread and fill with the cooked beef.
Serve with tahini sauce and a side of salad.
In a pan, sauté cumin, coriander, and garam masala for 1 minute.
Add the boiled potatoes, peas, and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes.
Allow the filling to cool, then stuff into the samosa wrappers.
Fry the samosas in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
Serve with chutney or yogurt sauce.
Cook the basmati rice until half done and set aside.
In a pot, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add garam masala, cumin, and chicken, and cook until the chicken is browned.
Add tomatoes and simmer for 20 minutes.
Layer the chicken with the half-cooked rice, cover, and steam for 15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.
In a karahi (wok), heat oil and sauté onion, garlic paste, and ginger paste.
Add mutton and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Simmer until mutton is tender, about 30-40 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.
In a blender, combine yogurt, mango, milk, sugar, and cardamom powder.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add ice cubes and blend again.
Serve chilled in glasses.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix walnuts, cinnamon, and half the sugar.
Layer phyllo sheets in a greased baking dish, brushing each with melted butter.
Spread the walnut mixture on top, and layer more phyllo sheets on top.
Cut into diamond shapes and bake for 45 minutes until golden.
In a saucepan, boil water and the remaining sugar until syrupy. Add vanilla.
Pour the syrup over the baked baklava and let it soak before serving.

ingredients: Pita bread and tahini sauce for serving

steps: Drain and rinse soaked chickpeas.
In a food processor, blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, and salt until coarse.
Form mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the falafel until golden brown.
Serve with pita bread and tahini sauce.
In a food processor, combine dates, nuts, cocoa powder, and honey.
Blend until a sticky dough forms.
Roll the mixture into small balls.
Roll the balls in desiccated coconut.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

ingredients: 4 bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed

steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix cooked rice, ground meat, diced tomatoes, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the prepared bell peppers.
Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 30 minutes, then uncover and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes until cheese is melted.
In a saucepan, combine rice, coconut milk, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Once thickened, remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with toasted coconut.

ingredients: Lemon slices and mint sprigs for garnish

steps: In a blender, combine lemon juice, mint leaves, sugar, and 1 cup of water.
Blend until mint is finely chopped.
Strain the mixture into a pitcher, discarding solids.
Add the remaining water and stir well.
Serve over ice, garnished with lemon slices and mint sprigs.
In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery; sauté until softened.
Add garlic and cumin, cooking for an additional minute.
Stir in lentils and broth, bringing to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve warm.
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, salt, and pepper; pulse until blended.
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat; fry falafel until golden brown.
Serve wrapped in pita bread with tahini sauce and fresh vegetables.
In a blender, combine peach, mango, yogurt, milk, honey, and ice cubes.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
Melt dark chocolate in a bowl over simmering water, stirring until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale.
Fold melted chocolate into the egg yolk mixture.
In another bowl, whip cream with vanilla until soft peaks form.
Fold whipped cream into chocolate mixture.
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with salt until stiff peaks form, then fold into chocolate mixture.
Spoon into serving dishes and chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Preheat grill over medium heat.
Grill salmon for about 6-7 minutes on each side until cooked through.
Serve garnished with lemon slices.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a mixing bowl, mix mashed bananas with melted butter.
Stir in baking soda and salt.
Mix in sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla.
Stir in flour until just incorporated.
Pour batter into a greased loaf pan and bake for 50 minutes.
Cool before slicing.
In a blender, combine honeydew, yogurt, honey, and ice cubes.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glasses and garnish with mint leaves.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a baking dish, layer sliced apples.
In a bowl, combine oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and melted butter; mix until crumbly.
Spread oat mixture over the apples.
Bake for 30 minutes until apples are tender and topping is golden brown.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired.
In a large bowl, combine ground beef, grated onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Mix until well combined and form into long, oval shapes on skewers.
Preheat grill or skillet over medium heat.
Brush kebabs with olive oil and grill for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Serve with pita and tzatziki sauce.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
Cooked rice or noodles for serving

steps: In a large pan, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger; stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Stir in soy sauce and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Serve over cooked rice or noodles, garnished with sesame seeds.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract until smooth.
In another bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the wet mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions; drain.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes and basil; simmer for 10 minutes.
Toss the cooked spaghetti in the sauce, season with salt and pepper.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
Cook fettuccine according to package instructions; drain.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and cook chicken until no longer pink.
Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Combine chicken and sauce with fettuccine; season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley before serving.
Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Butter one side of each slice of bread.
Place one slice in the skillet, buttered side down, and add cheese on top.
Cover with the other slice of bread, buttered side up.
Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted.
In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and pour batter to form pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve with maple syrup.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions; drain.
In a skillet, cook ground beef until browned; drain fat.
In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, salt, and pepper.
In a baking dish, layer noodles, ricotta mixture, marinara sauce, ground beef, and mozzarella.
Repeat layers, finishing with mozzarella and Parmesan on top.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes; remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
In a pot, sauté onion and garlic until translucent.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk and chicken broth; simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with cilantro before serving.
Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Spread marinara sauce over the pizza crust.
Top with mozzarella cheese and desired toppings.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until cheese is bubbly and crust is golden.
Garnish with oregano before serving.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, milk, and cinnamon.
Dip bread slices in the mixture, coating both sides.
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook bread until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with maple syrup.
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and salt.
Blend until smooth, adding water if needed for desired consistency.
Serve with pita bread.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, zucchini, etc.)

steps: In a pot, sauté green curry paste for 1 minute.
Add chicken or tofu and cook until browned.
Pour in coconut milk and chicken broth; bring to a simmer.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender.
Season with salt, garnish with fresh basil before serving.
